snippet: Alton Sterling, a black man, was killed outside a store on Tuesday. Video of the shooting spread quickly, setting off protests in the Louisiana city....
abstract: Justice Dept opens investigation into fatal shooting of Alton B Sterling by police in Baton Rouge, La, after release of video reignites, once again, furor over killings of black men by law enforcement; video depicts officer shooting Sterling while other officers have him pinned to ground during arrest.

byline.original: By RICHARD FAUSSET, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and CAMPBELL ROBERTSON
byline.contributor: Richard Fausset reported from Baton Rouge, Richard Perez-Pena from New York and Campbell Robertson from New Orleans. Reporting was contributed by Mike McPhate and Jonah Engel Bromwich from New York, Allen Johnson from Baton Rouge and Timothy Williams from Washington. Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Alton Sterling, a black man, was killed outside a store on Tuesday. Video of the shooting spread quickly, setting off protests in the Louisiana city.

headline.main: Alton Sterling Shooting in Baton Rouge Prompts Justice Dept. Investigation
headline.print_headline: U.S. Examines Police Killing in Louisiana
